snippet: International students earning degrees in science, technology, engineering and mathematics fields in the United States will now be eligible to stay for three years of on-the-job training.
abstract: Federal government is set to publish new rule making international students earning degrees in science, technology, engineering and mathematics eligible for three years of on-the-job training; revised rule extends period allowed under STEM Optional Practical Training program by seven months; rule is set to take effect in May.
lead_paragraph: International students earning degrees in science, technology, engineering and mathematics fields in the United States will now be eligible to stay for three years of on-the-job training.

headline.main: New U.S. Rule Extends Stay for Some Foreign Graduates
headline.print_headline: New U.S. Rule Extends Stay for Some Foreign Graduates
